intro: Antidesma boridiense, commonly known as the African snowberry, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody, spherical fruits that turn red when mature. Its botanical features make it an important species in its native ecosystems, often found in woodland and savanna habitats.
